comments:
Not sure if this is setup or a real bug, but custom Ant tasks contributed via 
the org.eclipse.ant.core.extraClasspathEntries are not found in the attached 
plugin.  This problem is a blocker for the releng team in that we are unable 
to test some of our internal Ant tasks contributed using this mechanism.

Created an attachment (id=10793)
plugin contributing custom Ant task

I tried running the Task from a script such as:

<project default="run">
<target name="run">
	<taskdef name="foo" classname="MyTask"/>
	<foo/>
</target>
</project>

Are you running in the same or a separate VM?
I suspect separate VM.
For extra classpath entries to be available in a separate VM build you need to 
make use of the eclipseRuntime attribute (set it to false; default is true).
I tried both.  The Ant task was not found when I tried running in the same vm.

I am looking into it...other contributed jars are showing up fine (such as for 
our test suite). Yours is not...

It appears that unless you have 
<?eclipse version="3.0"?>
in your plugin.xml the extension point extensions are not picked up.
Is this a known issue Jeff?

Confirming that adding <?eclipse version="3.0"?> to the plugin.xml fixes the 
problem.
Looks like a duplicate of bug 62745. Do you get a similar log as in that bug, Sonia?

Created an attachment (id=10810)
The plug-in that works
Yes I get the FrameworkEvent.ERROR with the stack trace of bug 62745.

You are right Rafael, I found the following entry in the .log trying to
reproduce Sonia's pb. Sonia also confirmed me that she has that:
